item.title: North Seattle Picnics in the Precincts is This Saturday!
item.description: Did you know the only Police Station in all of North Seattle is right here in Licton Springs? Now is your chance to meet them! This Saturday, August 18th from 1 pm to 4 pm at the Seattle Police Dept-North Precinct (10049 College Way N) the police department will be …

item.title: Licton Springs chosen for Home Zone pilot
item.description: We're excited to announce that Seattle Neighborhood Greenways has selected the southeastern corner of Licton Springs for its pioneering home zone pilot in North Seattle! Home Zones represent an innovative and inexpensive approach to increasing walkability, safety, and the sense of community in neighborhoods that lack full sidewalk coverage. The …

item.title: Night Out Success!
item.description:
Thank you to everyone that came out across Licton Springs to meet with your neighbors and make 2018 another great success! Across the Licton Springs area, hundreds of neighbors got to know each other across over seven block parties.

item.title: More frequent bus service coming soon near you
item.description: Starting this September the frequency of the E Line, in addition to many other regional bus lines, will be increased. This change is happening thanks to a partnership between Amazon, the City of Seattle, and King County Metro. This will be a particularly welcome addition over the next few years …

item.title: North Seattle Greenway Construction

item.description:
Serving up delicious Latin Cuisine right on Aurora Avenue, Tropicos Breeze has long been one of Licton Spring's most beloved restaurants. So, when I was told the Licton Springs location had closed, I feared the worse.

item.title: This small Seattle neighborhood is experiencing big changes.
item.description: Licton Springs is looking to become even more well prepared for the urban demands of being a < 14 minute light rail ride from downtown. item.title: A new bridge is set to bring two Seattle neighbourhoods closer together
item.description: Licton Springs is set to feel even more connected to Maple Leaf and the rest of the Northgate area. With the construction of a pedestrian bridge on 100th, you will never have to walk more than 5 minutes North or South to cross over I5 and into Maple Leaf. This …

item.title: An early preview of Spring in Licton Springs
item.description: In hopefully an early preview of what Spring has to offer this year, Licton Springs Park was a beautiful sight this weekend backdropped by clear Seattle skies.
